thread.title: Vile burglar who attempted to rape a deaf and blind 94-year-old great-grandmother, caged
thread.title_full: Vile burglar who attempted to rape a deaf and blind 94-year-old great-grandmother, caged

title: Vile burglar who attempted to rape a deaf and blind 94-year-old great-grandmother, caged
text:
REUTERS 1 of 12 Charles Manson is an American criminal who formed a commune called the Manson family in the late 60s who committed a series of murders 
Willis, a father of four who was drunk at the time of the crime, reportedly stumbled onto a middle-class residential estate at 12:30am as a family gathering began to wind down. 
Prosecutor Jonathan Straw told the court that Willis snuck into the house as the victim’s relatives chatted away in another room. 
Judge Pini said: “The victim is 94 years of age. She had not long before this left a nursing home to be cared for in a safe, loving environment for the remaining time of her life. WIKICOMMONS Willis was sented to 14 years in Lincoln Crown Court, pictured 
“She was registered blind, hard of hearing, had no short term memory, had poor balance and was doubly incontinent. She could not communicate. She was as frail and vulnerable as it is possible to be.” 
The victim had been sleeping on a hospital trolley in the front room as she was left virtually bedridden since suffering a fall, the court heard. 
Prosecutor Straw said: “The victim was in bed. The covers had been pulled back and her pyjama bottoms had been pulled off. Related articles
